page.title: 04Crops and livestock
page.content: The Rendcomb area is one of mixed farming where arable crops (spring wheat,spring barley & winter wheat) are grown.About half of the farms in this area had dairy herds with upto 310 Freisian cattle.Some cattle would eat the grass right down to the roots and would eventually destroy the pasture.On most farms the EEC effects were being felt.Beef was in plenty on some of the farms and a suckling herd on Marsden Manor had been given up.Nearly all the farms had grazing land for their various livestock.Hay being cut was used mainly for silage but also for animals such as horses.There was also a large number of sheep on most farms.In Rendcomb some farms have not got any crops but have concentrated on livestock.
